result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio R Truss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of Dangerous Weapon], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
**08-24-15/ Stephanie Rothstein**
The Court ordered the sentence on Count 2 is commuted to 12 months in the HOC
**PROBATION REVIEW HEARING March 25, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 24.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all costs, fees and surcharges (including the Domestic Abuse Assessment) during period of probation. Bail on deposit to apply to costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
If revoked, to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds.

*NO contact with Ashley L., Michelle L., or any other witnesses to the offense or their residence.
*Court will allow the defendant to have visitation with his children subject to third party supervision.
*1/14/2016  No Contact Order remains in effect.

*Attend a Batterer's Intervention Program.
*Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs.
*Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Court waived DNA surcharge on Court 3 as it is part of a continuous event.
*Voting admonishment given.

timeConds.notes:
*Imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent.
*1/14/2016  Stay lifted.  To serve 40 days, straight time. Forthwith.  Credit for 33 days.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.
*1/14/2016  Court added 60 days condition time.  STAYED pending review hrg.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To Count 2 amended, credit for 2 days time served. Defendant may have work release and participate in vocational training. Court will allow the defendant to participate in the Day Reporting  Center if eligible. Court will allow the defendant to receive good time. Defendant to report to the HOC to begin the sentence on Count 3 on 07/31/15 by 10:00 am.

Count two, per review hearing on 1/14/2016.

Defendant Antonio R Truss in court PRO SE, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Kate Frkovich in court. Probation Status Review report reviewed along with injunction paperwork.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 40 days of the condition time; straight time; with credit for 33 days time served; forthwith. Court further added 60 days conditions time stayed pending review to defendant's probation conditions. No contact order remains in effect. Case remains scheduled for Probation Review Hearing on 3/25/2016 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio R Truss in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Defendant appeared late and the court had started a jury trial.  Court admonished defendant for being late.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILED, SUBPOENA (served and signed on 04-06-2015)

BRANCH 4 (FLANAGAN)  FOR BRANCH 40 (DALLET)
Defendant Antonio R Truss in court with attorney Jessica Bellows. Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State Court ordered case DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State and agreement of the Parties Court added the modifier of Use of a Dangerous Weapon under Wisconsin Stats. 939.63, and which time Defendant plead GUILTY.

Firearms warnings given. Voting admonishment given. DNA notification given.

Jury Trial set for 06-08-2015 is VACATED.
Branch 4 agreed to take this matter for plea and sentencing as Court is in trial.  rmm

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
